DataElement.preferredName: Liver Metastasis Patient Surgeon Decision Eligibility Determination Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator related to decision of sugeon as criteria for determining eligibility of patients with liver metastases.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Liver Metastasis Patient Surgeon Decision Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to decision of sugeon as criteria for determining eligibility of patients with liver metastases.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.:Cancer that has spread from the organ in which it first appeared to another organ. For example, breast cancer cells may spread (metastasize) to the lungs and cause the growth of a new tumor. When this happens, the disease is called metastatic breast cancer.:A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Concepts.definition: A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation.:A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A physician who treats disease, injury, and deformity by operation or manipulation that involves gaining access to the patient's body by incisional access.
A position, opinion, or judgment reached on an issue under consideration.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: NSABP CRF:National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Case Report Form

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the past four weeks, has a hepatic surgeon determined that the patient's liver metastases are resectable based on the following criteria?

ReferenceDocuments.name: In the past four weeks, has a
ReferenceDocuments.description: In the past four weeks, has a hepatic surgeon determined that the patient's liver metastases are resectable based on the following criteria? - A complete resection can be performed in a single operation AND - There are at least two uninvolved contiguous segments of the liver

DataElement.origin: NSABP CRF:National Surgical Adjuvant Breast and Bowel Project Case Report Form
